pageContext.claim: “All I did was be a good candidate. Russia didn't help me. Russia did not help me. There was no collusion. There was none of that.”
pageContext.analysis: Russia hacked and strategically released emails from Hillary Clinton and Democratic committees during the 2016 race, and used fake personas to spread propaganda and disinformation online. The efforts were designed to undermine faith in U.S. democracy, help Trump and hurt Clinton, according to the U.S. intelligence community. There is debate whether this effort pushed Trump over the top, but some intelligence experts say Russia's interference likely had an effect in closely contested states.
